comments:
I got the following problems in the error log:

eclipse.buildId=I20050219-1500
java.version=1.4.2_07
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=solaris, ARCH=sparc, WS=motif, NL=en
Command-line arguments:  -os solaris -ws motif -arch sparc



!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 1 1 2005-09-30 09:40:52.806
!MESSAGE Could not load library: libcore_3_1_0.so.  This library provides 
platform-specific optimizations for certain file system operations.  This 
library is not present on all platforms, so this may not be an error.  The 
resources plug-in will safely fall back to using java.io.File functionality.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.cdt.core 4 4 2005-09-30 09:40:55.386
!MESSAGE Background Indexer Crash Recovery
!STACK 0
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: 
org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject.getContentTypeMatcher()
Lorg/eclipse/core/runtime/content/IContentTypeMatcher;
        at org.eclipse.cdt.core.CCorePlugin.getContentType(CCorePlugin.java:883)
        at org.eclipse.cdt.core.model.CoreModel.isValidTranslationUnitName
(CoreModel.java:201)
        at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.index.domsourceindexer.DOMAddFolderToIndex$1.visit
(DOMAddFolderToIndex.java:72)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource$1.visitElement
(Resource.java:52)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTreeIterator.doIteration
(ElementTreeIterator.java:81)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTreeIterator.doIteration
(ElementTreeIterator.java:85)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTreeIterator.iterate
(ElementTreeIterator.java:126)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.accept(Resource.java:62)
        at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.index.domsourceindexer.DOMAddFolderToIndex.execute
(DOMAddFolderToIndex.java:66)
        at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.search.processing.JobManager.run
(JobManager.java:466)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:534)

Looks like a version mismatch. Are you using CDT 3.0 with Eclipse 3.0 instead 
of Eclipse 3.1?

(In reply to comment #1)
> Looks like a version mismatch. Are you using CDT 3.0 with Eclipse 3.0 instead 
> of Eclipse 3.1?

This is the description that appears in the "about Eclipse Platform" box

Eclipse Platform

Version: 3.1.0
Build id: I20050219-1500

I have marked this defect as WORKSFORME.   This error only happens when you mix versions of Eclipse and CDT.  I would suggest that you re-install both from scratch in an empty directory and start with a new workspace.  If you can reproduce the problem, please re-open the defect and add the exact version of CDT (as well as Eclipse -- If you are using a different version than you already reported here)
